StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [UpdateProgram_Assign]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @ProgramAvailabilityID int, @ContractID int, @DutyPreference1 varchar(10), @DutyPreference2 varchar(10), @DutyPreference3 varchar(10), @LastEditBy varchar(50) ) AS
UPDATE PROGRAM_AVAILABILITY SET CONTRACT_ID = @ContractID, PROGRAM_ASSIGNMENT_DATE = GETDATE(), USER_LOGIN = @LastEditBy, UPDATE_DATE = GETDATE() WHERE PROGRAM_AVAILABILITY_ID = @ProgramAvailabilityID
-- This check is required so programs without a duty pref op.on do not overwrite previously-assigned duty prefs. -- This is a terrible design, but we are unable to make database schema changes at this .me. - KMM - 9/1/2008 IF (@DutyPreference1 IS NOT NULL OR @DutyPreference2 IS NOT NULL OR @DutyPreference3 IS NOT NULL) BEGIN UPDATE CONTRACT SET DUTY_PREFERENCE1 = @DutyPreference1, DUTY_PREFERENCE2 = @DutyPreference2, DUTY_PREFERENCE3 = @DutyPreference3, USER_LOGIN = @LastEditBy, UPDATE_DATE = GETDATE() WHERE CONTRACT_ID = @ContractID END
